multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: rates; Defense policy shift may lift risk premium, pushing US 10Y yields higher.

category.motivation: The article reports an official announcement by the White House regarding a proposed renaming of a federal department, which constitutes a policy statement.

impact.motivation: The article concerns a US defense policy change that does not map to any of the canonical market handles (indices, rates, FX, commodities, credit/vol) and lacks a clear causal path to those assets.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports an immediate political decision that could affect defense policy and spending in the short term.

article_node.title: White House advances plan for Department of War as Trump looks to restore historical military title
article_node.summary: The White House announced plans to rename the Department of Defense back to the Department of War, a change championed by President Trump as a return to offensive military values. Trump said the renaming could occur within the next week or so, and White House deputy press secretary Anna Kelly framed it as restoring historic military identity. The proposal would require congressional approval, but Trump expressed confidence that Congress would cooperate. The announcement follows a broader push for Pentagon reforms and a shift toward a more aggressive defense posture.
